revised_title: The Role of Oxygen in Putrefaction and the Development of Vibrio-Life
tldr: Dr. F. Crace-Calvert investigates the role of oxygen in the development of putrefactive vibrios and the transformation of monads into microzyma. He demonstrates that oxygen is essential for the growth of vibrio-life and that the products emitted by these microorganisms can be detrimental to their development and locomotion.
